{"metadata":{"objective":"Add support","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"CS16/3/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">Everything went wrong . . .</span><br /><br />You are working on a one-paragraph letter to the manager of the Gravel Mountain Motel.&nbsp; After a really bad experience there, you want your money back.<br /><br />You know your audience and purpose and have a topic sentence to begin your paragraph, but now you need to add details and support to convince the manager to give you a refund.<br /><br />Note:&nbsp; For an essay, your paragraph may be different.&nbsp; <img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" />See the mini-lesson on <em>Body paragraphs for an essay</em> for more information.</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Dear Gravel Mountain Motel Manager,</p><p>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.</p><p><span class=\"marker\">What comes next??</span></p><p>.</p><p>Please refund the cost of our hotel room as soon as possible.</p><p>Sincerely,<br />Ticked-off Traveler</p></td></tr></tbody></table>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"1","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":"0","audioPath":"2"},"leftText":"<p>In order to make your opinion heard and believed, you need to do more than just state your own ideas.<br /><br />You need to give your audience specific details, facts, and examples that illustrate the topic sentence of the paragraph.<br /><br />This is called <strong>support</strong>, and it helps your readers understand your message.<br />&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"What are supporting details?","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of a paragraph. The first part is the topic sentence. The second part is the supporting details. The last part is the concluding sentence. The supporting details part usually has several sentences.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"3"},"rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Fact:&nbsp; </span>Official data from ComReg tells us that Ireland has over five million mobile phone users.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Statistic</span>:&nbsp; Eighty percent of adults who wore a uniform when they attended school state that it was a positive experience.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Example</span>:&nbsp; The TV in our room was not working.</p>","leftText":"<p>Good support relates directly to your topic sentence. &nbsp; It contains facts, statistics, and examples.<br /><br />When you use information that you learn from a source, remember to give credit to the source with an in-text citation and a list of references.<br />&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Support for a paragraph that...</span><br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Shares information:</span></p><p>The city of Boston has many historic sites from the Revolutionary War.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Tells a story:</span></p><p>While I was trying to learn how to use the copying machine, my boss called me into her office.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Convinces someone:</span></p><p>Another reason kids should not wear uniforms to school is that uniforms stifle creativity.</p>","leftText":"<p>When adding support to your writing, keep your <strong>purpose</strong> and your <strong>audience </strong>in mind.&nbsp;&nbsp; Provide support that makes sense for the type of paragraph you are writing.<br />&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0","audioPath":"5"},"leftText":"<p>You need to decide what support to include for your paragraph.&nbsp; Think about what your topic sentence says:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.</span><br /><br />Ask yourself what information can prove, show, or explain what you are saying.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">What happened when I stayed at the motel?</span></p><p>The visit was uncomfortable.</p><p>The walls were thin, and the other guests were noisy.</p><p>We didn&#39;t like anything that was on the local TV stations, and the TV was not working correctly so we couldn&#39;t watch movies.</p><p>When we called the desk to complain, no one was available to speak with us.&nbsp; When we did speak to someone, he was rude and unhelpful.</p><p>We couldn&#39;t stand being there.</p>","headerText":"Deciding what supporting details to include"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<div>Now you need to choose which support to use.<br /><br />When support is not specific, it is not as convincing.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br /><br />The reader needs details in order to understand what the writer is trying to say.<br />&nbsp;</div>","rightText":"<div><div><div><div><p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Support that is not convincing:</span></p><p>The whole visit was uncomfortable.&nbsp;</p><p>We couldn&#39;t stand being there.</p></div></div></div></div>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"leftText":"<p>Think about your audience--the manager of the Gravel Mountain Motel.&nbsp;&nbsp; Make sure you include details that will be important to the manager.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Details that are important to the manager:</span></p><p>The TV was not working correctly</p><p>The person working at the desk was rude and unhelpful</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":"0","audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width:100%\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Careful!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Your &nbsp;opinion is not a convincing detail.&nbsp; Convincing support is factual and accurate.</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Opinion vs. factual support:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-orangetimesph\" style=\"color:#F79A1F;font-weight:bold;\">x</span>&nbsp;&nbsp; We didn&#39;t like anything that was on the local TV stations.</p><p><span class=\"ju-greencheckph\" style=\"color:#08A47D;font-weight:bold;\">v&nbsp;</span>&nbsp; The TV was not working correctly.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"9"},"leftText":"<p>After thinking about your topic sentence and your purpose and audience, choose the support you will use for your paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Support you have chosen:</span></p><p>The walls were thin, and the other guests were noisy.</p><p>The TV was not working correctly.</p><p>When we called the desk to complain, no one was available to speak with us.</p><p>When we did speak to someone, he was rude and unhelpful.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"10"},"leftText":"<p>How much support is enough?&nbsp;&nbsp; As the writer, you need enough support to give your reader a complete view of what you are writing about.&nbsp; Many writers include three pieces of support when planning an effective paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Careful!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Often a first draft will not include enough support.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Be sure to review the support you have selected to make sure it is convincing, and add details to your paragraph if needed.</td></tr></tbody></table><p><br /><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" style=\"width: 27px; height: 27px;\" />&nbsp; <a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS16/3/Pictureit_Providingconvincingsupport.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=no,dependent=yes,width=826,left=100,height=750,top=50'); return false;\">Providing convincing support: Picture it!</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS16/3/Screen_reader_picture_it_providing_convincing_support.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/accessible_icon.png\" style=\"width: 17px; height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of Providing convincing support, opens in a new tab</span></a><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"11"},"leftText":"<p>Your last step is adding&nbsp;a <strong>concluding sentence </strong>to reinforce the main idea of the paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of a paragraph. The first part is the topic sentence. The second part is the supporting details. The last part is the concluding sentence.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Writing a concluding sentence"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"12"},"leftText":"<p>The concluding sentence should restate your topic sentence, saying the same idea, but using different words.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic Sentence: </span></p><p>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Concluding sentence:&nbsp;</span></p><p>For these reasons, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"13"},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width:100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><ul><li>Your topic sentence tells what you are writing about (<strong>topic</strong>)&nbsp; and what you want to say about it (<strong>main idea</strong>).</li><li>Adding <strong>support </strong>will convince your reader that your ideas are good.</li><li>Ending with a <strong>concluding sentence</strong> that restates the topic sentence will leave your reader with a clear understanding of what your paragraph is about.</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-powertip\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">ASK YOURSELF: Deciding what support to use<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">&nbsp;,</span></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><ul><li>What support will tell my reader more about my topic sentence and prove, show, or explain the main idea?</li><li>What support will convince my audience that I am correct?</li><li>Is my support detailed enough&nbsp;and based on facts, statistics, or examples?</li></ul><p><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" style=\"width: 27px; height: 27px;\" /> <a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS16/3/AskYourself_Support.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=no,dependent=yes,width=800,left=100,height=800,top=0'); return false;\">Ask yourself: Deciding what support to use, Picture it!</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS16/3/Screen_reader_ask_yourself_deciding_what_support_to_use.html\" target=\"_blank\"><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/accessible_icon.png\" style=\"width: 17px; height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of ask yourself: deciding what support to use, opens in a new tab</span></a></p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":""},"leftText":"<p>Here is your letter with its supporting details and concluding sentence.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Dear Gravel Mountain Motel Manager,</p><p>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.&nbsp; The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m. We tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work, giving us an error message that said, &quot;Please contact the main desk to resolve problem.&quot; When we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby,&nbsp;and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems. Instead he told us, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot; For these reasons, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.</p><p>Please refund the cost of our hotel room as soon as possible.</p><p>Sincerely,<br />Ticked-off Traveler</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
